DRAMADIRECTOR.title: Drama Director

intro.title: Title
intro.subtitle: Subtitle
intro.sincityDesc: Noir-style intro. Campaign name at an angle, characters in strict B/W silhouettes, names in red with white outline. Finale â€” 'Directed by' with GM name.
intro.snatchDesc: Guy Ritchie style intro. Campaign name, then each character: portrait with instant duotone transition on random colored background. Finale â€” 'Directed by'.
intro.macheteDesc: 70s Grindhouse cinema intro. Reverse film countdown, warm amber palette, lobby cards with film scratches and cigarette burns.
intro.macheteBloodDesc: Screen slowly fills with blood from top to bottom. Accompanied by evil laughter.
intro.hint: Choose a cinematic intro style below. The Campaign Name field is used for some intro animations. Select a target player or leave blank to show to all.

endings.wbrbDesc: Freeze frame + Eric Andre style title card. Screen desaturates and freezes, the text appears instantly in the top-left corner.
endings.jojoDesc: Classic anime-style ending: freeze frame, character portraits, credits with player names and GM production credit.
endings.hint: Play a cinematic end-of-session card for all players. WBRB pauses the scene, JoJo shows a dramatic freeze-frame ending.

video.hint: Video is shown on top of the screen for all players (or selected one). GM sees the âœ• button to close.
video.instructionHint: Select a video file (mp4/webm) using the folder button or paste a path directly. Set loop and volume, then press Play. Use Stop to close the player on all screens.

vn.desc: Full-screen VN overlay on top of the scene.
vn.features:
â€¢ Up to 20 characters (10 left, 10 right)
â€¢ Auto-activation by microphone â€” highlights the speaker
â€¢ Speech recognition â†’ subtitles for all players
â€¢ Background presets, rosters and full scenes
vn.launchLocalTitle: Open VN only for yourself (no broadcast to players)
vn.charEmpty: No characters added. Click '+ Left' or '+ Right'.
vn.dlgGmHint: When GM speaks â€” selected character activates. Subtitles go in their name.
vn.micHint: Microphone turns on automatically when VN launches. Each player grants access in their browser.
vn.micSpeechHint: Text is recognized and shown as subtitles in the dialogue window for all players.
vn.helpLaunchText1: Click the Launch VN button in the panel header. The overlay appears for all players simultaneously. Close with the Close VN button or the red button on the overlay.
vn.helpLaunchText2: The For Self button opens VN only for you (GM), without broadcasting to players. Useful for preparing a scene before showing.
vn.helpBgItem1: Paste the file path manually or click to select via file browser. Supports images (jpg, png, webp) and videos (mp4, webm).
vn.helpBgItem2: Fit â€” how background fits the screen: cover crops edges, contain shows fully with bars, fill stretches.
vn.helpBgItem3: Background Color â€” underlay color, visible if image is smaller than screen.
vn.helpBgItem4: Dim â€” semi-transparent black layer over background (0 = none, 1 = fully black).
vn.helpBgItem5: Quick Select â€” click a tile to instantly apply background. Active tile is highlighted gold. Use search field to filter.
vn.helpBgItem6: Add button lets you create custom background groups with multiple variants (day/night, etc.).
vn.helpCharsItem1: + Left and + Right buttons add a character to the corresponding side of the screen.
vn.helpCharsItem2: Player field â€” link character to a Foundry user. When that player speaks into the mic â€” character activates automatically.
vn.helpCharsItem3: Visibility (Visible checkbox) â€” hidden characters don't appear on overlay but remain in the list.
vn.helpCharsItem5: Scale, X, Y â€” positioning and size of character on stage.
vn.helpCharsItem6: button â€” activate character (highlighted, others dimmed). Active character is slightly enlarged.
vn.helpCharsItem7: button â€” move character from left side to right and back.
vn.helpCharsItem8: buttons â€” change order in row.
vn.helpCharsItem9: Rosters (at bottom of tab) â€” save current character set under a name, load later with one click.
vn.helpDlgItem1: Fill in Speaker and text, then click Show â€” dialogue window appears for all players.
vn.helpDlgItem2: From active button â€” automatically inserts name and color of currently active character.
vn.helpDlgItem3: Auto-close â€” dialogue hides after specified seconds (0 = manual).
vn.helpMicItem1: Microphone turns on automatically when VN launches. Each user must grant browser access.
vn.helpMicItem2: Volume Threshold â€” minimum sound level to detect speech. Increase if character activates from background noise, decrease if not responding to quiet voice.
vn.helpMicItem3: When a player speaks â€” their character (linked via Player field) is automatically highlighted on stage for everyone.
vn.helpMicItem4: Recognized speech is displayed as subtitles inside the dialogue window.
vn.helpMicItem5: button in top right corner of overlay lets you quickly toggle microphone during play.
vn.helpGmBarText: Appears on the left side of screen only for GM when VN is active.
vn.helpGmBarItem1: Speaking â€” select which character GM speaks as. When GM speaks into mic â€” this character highlights and subtitles go in their name.
vn.helpGmBarItem2: Actors button â€” opens/closes list of all scene characters:
vn.helpGmBarItem2a: LMB on character â€” show / hide them on stage
vn.helpGmBarItem2b: RMB on character â€” move from left side to right and back
vn.helpGmBarItem2c: button â€” activate / deactivate character
vn.helpGmBarItem2d: Player dropdown â€” link character to user directly from left panel
vn.helpGmBarItem3: Backgrounds button â€” opens quick list of all backgrounds. Click a background â€” it applies immediately. Active background has gold stripe on left.
vn.helpGmBarItem4: Both sections have search in real time.
vn.helpQuickBarItem1: Buttons in top right corner of overlay are available to all users.
vn.helpQuickBarItem2: â€” toggle microphone on/off
vn.helpQuickBarItem3: â€” open Chat in separate window
vn.helpQuickBarItem4: â€” open Actors in separate window
vn.helpQuickBarItem5: â€” open Scenes in separate window
vn.helpQuickBarItem6: â€” open Playlists in separate window
vn.helpQuickBarItem7: â€” open Items in separate window
vn.helpPresetsItem1: Scene presets â€” save complete VN state: background, all characters with settings, dialogue parameters. Convenient for prepared scenes.
vn.helpPresetsItem2: Character rosters (on Characters tab) â€” save only character composition without background.
vn.helpLayersText: Layers allow you to add text and images on top of the VN scene. They are positioned independently of characters.
vn.helpLayersItem1: + Image â€” add an image layer. Specify the path to the file or use the file browser.
vn.helpLayersItem2: + Text â€” add a text layer. Enter the text in the field that appears.
vn.helpLayersItem3: X, Y â€” position of the layer on the screen (in pixels, 1920Ã—1080 canvas).
vn.helpLayersItem4: Z â€” z-index: the higher the value, the higher the layer is above others.
vn.helpLayersItem5: W, H â€” width and height of the layer (for images).
vn.helpLayersItem7: Scale â€” scale multiplier for the layer.
vn.helpLayersItem8: Visible â€” checkbox to show/hide the layer without deleting it.
vn.helpLayersItem9: Buttons â€” change the order of layers in the list.
vn.helpLayersItem10: Presets â€” save and load sets of layers for reuse.
vn.helpInteractiveText: Interactive images are clickable elements on the VN scene. When clicked, they trigger a Foundry macro.
vn.helpInteractiveItem1: Add â€” add a new interactive image.
vn.helpInteractiveItem2: Image path â€” specify the path to the image file.
vn.helpInteractiveItem3: Macro â€” select which macro to run when the image is clicked.
vn.helpInteractiveItem4: X, Y, Z â€” position and layering on the screen.
vn.helpInteractiveItem5: W, H â€” dimensions of the clickable area.
vn.helpInteractiveItem6: When hovering over an interactive image, it glows and slightly increases in size.
vn.helpApiText: You can control VN from Foundry macros:

gml.horizonLineHint: Objects cannot be raised above their initial position
gml.playerControlHint: Players can drag their linked portraits

vn.helpDepthText: Depth Mode creates a perspective illusion: characters placed lower on the stage appear larger (closer), those higher appear smaller (further away). Enable it from the GM left panel when Mouse Control is active.
vn.helpDepthItem1: Scale Speed â€” controls how dramatically size changes with vertical position. At 1Ã— scale changes smoothly; higher values make the effect more pronounced.
vn.helpDepthItem2: Y Speed â€” multiplier for vertical mouse movement. Increase to make dragging characters up/down more sensitive.
vn.helpDepthItem3: Base Scale (on each character/layer) â€” the reference size at the horizon. The actual rendered scale = Base Scale Ã— perspective factor at that Y position.
vn.helpDepthItem4: The icon next to Scale in Characters and Layers tabs indicates that the slider controls Base Scale in depth mode, not final scale.
vn.helpDepthItem5: To disable depth mode uncheck the Depth Mode checkbox. Characters return to their Base Scale values.
vn.helpHorizonItem1: When Horizon Line is enabled, a fixed vanishing point is set at a specific vertical percentage of the stage (default 30% from top).
vn.helpHorizonItem2: Characters at or above the horizon appear at near-zero scale. Characters at the very bottom of the stage appear at maximum scale.
vn.helpHorizonItem3: Horizon Y % slider (0â€“90%) moves the horizon up or down. 0% = top edge, 50% = middle of stage.
vn.helpHorizonItem4: The horizon line also constrains vertical movement: characters cannot be dragged above their starting position if they are already at or near the horizon.
vn.charsHint: Add characters to the left, center, or right side. Each character can have a default image and an active image (shown when speaking). Link to a player so their voice activates the character automatically via microphone.
vn.layersHint: Layers sit on top of the scene independently of characters. X/Y in pixels on a 1920Ã—1080 canvas. Z controls stacking order. Lock a layer to prevent accidental changes.
vn.dialogueHint: Type the speaker name and dialogue text, then click Show. The dialogue box appears for all players. Use Â«From activeÂ» to auto-fill the currently highlighted character's name and color.

settings.languageHint: Override the module UI language. 'Auto' uses the Foundry language setting. Changing this will reload the page.
settings.vignetteIntensityHint: How dark the screen edges will be
settings.textDurationHint: How long text is displayed in milliseconds
settings.soundVolumeHint: Volume of sound effects from 0 to 1

notifications.noToken: Select a token on the map!
notifications.vnGmOnly: VN opened only for you (GM-only mode)
notifications.bgVariantRequired: Add at least one variant with a file.

DRAMADIRECTOR.charIntroHint: Shows character portrait with frame and entrance animation
DRAMADIRECTOR.noLayers: No layers. Click + Image or + Text to add.
DRAMADIRECTOR.interactiveHint: Interactive images float freely on screen. Players click them to trigger a macro.

effects.hint: Toggle visual effects on the player screen. Basic effects stack; filters replace each other. Click an active button again to turn it off. Use the Clear button to remove all effects at once.

textpics.hint: Display text and image overlays on player screens. Add up to 10 text layers and 10 image layers, adjust position with X/Y, size with W/H, depth with Z. Use presets to save and reuse layouts.
